**Louis Pasteur** (1822, Dole, France - 1895, Marnes-la-Coquette, France) - a French chemist and microbiologist.

***Pasteurization*** - a process of food preservation in which food products are treated with mild heat, usually to less
than 100 °C (212 °F), to eliminate microorganisms and extend shelf life.
